item.title: Jacob Tiberius Dog Hoke-Woodward – an Obituary
item.dc:creator: Tory
item.category: dear God I loved this dog
item.description:
After a long battle with arthritis and kidney disease, Jacob “Jake” Tiberius Dog Hoke-Woodward passed away peacefully on Saturday, July 16, 2016, in his home in Los Angeles, California. He was 13. Jake was born in Chatham County, NC, in November 2002. Along with three siblings, he was rescued by Chatham County Animal Rescue and… Continue reading Jacob Tiberius Dog Hoke-Woodward – an Obituary

item.title: Dear Self, One Year After IVF
item.dc:creator: Tory
item.description:
I wrote this April 29, 2015, while waiting to learn the results of my first IVF cycle. It is presented without further edit. It has swears. Hello Self, It’s me—you from a year ago! We’re about to try IVF. Boy, we could not get pregnant naturally! We could not at all. Well, we did once—after… Continue reading Dear Self, One Year After IVF

item.title: Dear Infertile People
item.dc:creator: Tory
item.description:
Dear infertile people, you are rad as hell. I’m not here to tell you it’s going to be OK. I have no idea where your journey goes. That’s kind of the reason your journey is so difficult. I’m not here to tell you how to get pregnant. Although if you haven’t been to /r/shittyfertilityadvice you… Continue reading Dear Infertile People

item.title: Dear Fertile People
item.dc:creator: Tory
item.description:
It’s National Infertility Awareness Week! Count me in. Been trying to have a kid for over three years, gotten treatment for two. Two HSGs, 4 IUIs, 3 failed IVFs, one hysteroscopy. Got pregnant once. Didn’t last. That was two years ago. Not ready to quit, but close. I’m infertile. Infertility means not being able to… Continue reading Dear Fertile People

item.title: Printable Poster for Zika Travel Awareness
item.dc:creator: Tory
item.description:
A doctor in the family reached out to ask if I could put together some kind of printable poster for Zika travel awareness—something printable for her office to spread the word about the mosquito-borne Zika virus and the threat it poses to babies of infected mothers. Apparently the CDC has distributed a printable poster for… Continue reading Printable Poster for Zika Travel Awareness

item.title: Background Check Your Doctor: Try This Health Care Provider Review Aggregator
item.dc:creator: Tory
item.description:
I wrote a suite of scripts to help you background check your doctor. The Primary Care Provider Investigator imports a list of health care providers and then scrapes multiple review sites (e.g. Yelp, UCompareHealthCare) to aggregate their reviews: PCPInvestigator. This project was born of frustration with my health insurer’s “search for a doctor” function, which… Continue reading Background Check Your Doctor: Try This Health Care Provider Review Aggregator
